qas.question: What did the political parties request a brief stop in?
What text was on the banner that the politicians unrolled outside?

answers.text: Respect for Human Rights in China

qas.question: What did MPs yell when the torch passed them?
Various French politicians started protests including members of what?
All the French political factions requested a temporary halt to what?
Why did the banner say that was unveiled during the temporary halt?

answers.text: Respect for Human Rights in China

qas.question: What did the Parliamentary members yell as the relay passed?

context: French members of <a3_0>Parliament<a3_0/> and other French politicians also organised a protest. All political parties in Parliament—UMP, Socialists, New Centre, Communists, Democratic Movement (centre) and Greens—jointly requested a pause in <a0_0>the <a4_0>National Assembly's session<a4_0/><a0_0/>, which was granted, so that MPs could step outside and unfurl a banner which read "<a1_0><a5_0>Respect for Human Rights in China<a5_0/><a1_0/>". The coach containing the torch drove past the National Assembly and the assembled protesting MPs, who shouted "<a2_0><a6_0>Freedom for Tibet!<a6_0/><a2_0/>" several times as it passed.
